chapter.title: Introduction
chapter.para: Jmol is far more than just a Java based tool for displaying 3D chemical information.

chapter.title: Command Line Options
chapter.para:
The program jmol has a command line option to run scripts: -script. The current syntax is:
jmol -script rasmol.script
This makes it possible to start jmol with a Rasmol script. The syntax of these scripts is explained in .

Alternatively, jmol can be started with one argument, being a file name:
jmol file

section.title: -Duser.language
section.para: In addition to the above command line options there is also one important Java option: -Duser.language. With this option the GUI language can be set. At this moment these languages are supported: en, es, and nl.

Alternatively, you can also use the LANG environment variable for setting the prefered language. This is common in many UNIX systems, like Linux. However, it is known not to work on Solaris and the above command line option must be used.

section.title: -Ddisplay.speed
section.para: The -Ddisplay.speed=fps option can be used to reporting the display speed in frames per second instead of milliseconds per frame.

section.title: Open
section.para:
Open files in Jmol. Jmol can read files of the following types:
ABINIT
ACES II
ADF - Amsterdam Density Functional
CML v1.0 and 1.0.1
GAMESS
Gaussian 92/94/98
Ghemical MM
Jaguar
MDL molfile
PDB (ATOM and HETATM entries only)
XYZ (single and multiple frame)

section.title: Recent Files...
section.para: Brings up a dialog with a list of the files the program has been asked to open recently. The file can be opened again by selecting it and clicking the Open button.

section.title: Script...
section.para: Opens a window where Rasmol scripting commands can be executed. contains information about Rasmol Scripts.

section.title: Export -> Export Image...
section.para:
Jmol can export images of the following types:
BMP
GIF
JPG
PNG
PPM
Note that GIF pictures can only be exported if the displayed image is 8 bit.

section.title: Export -> Render in pov-ray...
section.para: For high quality images, Jmol interfaces with the POV-Ray ray tracer. To use this feature, you must have the povray command line utility installed. You can download it from www.povray.org/.

section.title: Print
section.para: Postscript files can be exported directly to printer and to file.

section.title: Exit
section.para: Quits this Jmol session.

section.title: Select All
section.para: Selects all atoms in the view screen.

section.title: Deselect All
section.para: Deselects all atoms in the view screen.

section.title: Atom Properties...
section.para: This menu opens a dialog in which atomic properties can be added to a large number of atom types. These properties include the colors used to depict atoms.

section.title: Preferences...
section.para: This menu opens a dialog to change settings and make user customized preferences. These settings are saved from one session to the next

section.title: Display Tab
section.para: In these frame a few display settings can be changed. By default anti-aliasing is turned off. Turning it on improves the images considerably but will also reduce performance.

Note: The 1.3.1 JVM which ships with Macintosh OS X and OS X 10.2 (Jaguar) has crash bugs with some pixel interpolation and anti-aliasing operations. Therefore, you may need to disable the use of Java Graphics2D on this platform.

section.title: Colors Tab
section.para: In these frame some general display colors can be changed. Like the background color, and the color used to highlight selected atoms.

section.title: The Display menu
section.para: In this menu display settings/styles can be changed.

section.title: Quick Draw
section.para: Renders atoms as filled circles.

section.title: Shaded
section.para: Renders atoms as shaded spheres.

section.title: Wire Frame
section.para: Renders atoms as circle outlines.

section.title: Invisible
section.para: Atoms are not drawn, but are assumed to have the same radius that they would occupy. So bonds are drawn to the outer circumference of where the atom would be. Compare with *None*
This option can be useful when used in conjunction with atom labels to display atom type.

section.title: None
section.para: Atoms are not drawn and are assumed to have a radius of zero. Bonds are drawn to atom centers.
This option can be very useful when use in conjunction with atom labels to display atom type.

section.title: Quick Draw
section.para: Renders bonds as filled rectangles.

section.title: Shaded
section.para: Renders bonds as shaded cylinders.

section.title: Wire Frame
section.para: Renders bonds as lines.

section.title: Boxes
section.para: Renders bonds as rectangle outlines.

section.title: None
section.para: Bonds are not drawn.

section.title: None
section.para: No atom labels is shown.

section.title: Atomic Symbols
section.para: Atoms are labeled with their atomic symbol.

section.title: Atom Types
section.para: Atoms are labeled with their atom type. (What is the difference between Atom Type and Atom Symbol?)

section.title: Atom Numbers
section.para: Atoms are labeled with index numbers.

section.title: Atom Type
section.para: Atoms are colored based upon their type. Default colors are generally CPK colors

section.title: Atomic Charge
section.para: Atoms are colored based upon atomic charge. (Need more explanation here!)

section.title: Wireframe Rotation
section.para: This option may be checked if performance is unacceptable when manipulating large molecules. When this option is checked, wireframe rendering is used for displayed atoms and bonds during rotations, translations, and zoom operations. The molecule is rendered according to the current settings when the mouse is released.

section.title: Perspective Depth
section.para: This option controls rendering with perspective depth. When this option is unchecked molecules are rendered as a flat projection onto the screen. When checked, sizes and distances are adjusted for a camara perspective.
For a good example of this take a look at some of the crystal structures, such as samples/CdSe_nanocrystal.xyz or samples/HfO2_on_Si_relax.in

section.title: Hydrogens
section.para: Turns on/off the display of hydrogen atoms.

section.title: Vectors
section.para: Controls the display of vibrational vectors as dipole moments.

section.title: Measurements
section.para: Controls the display of distance, angle, and dihedral torsion measurements.

section.title: Front/Top/Bottom/Right/Left
section.para: Self explanatory. Useful with crystal structures.

section.title: Transform
section.para: Applies an AxisAngle rotation about user-specified coordinates.

section.title: Define center
section.para: Defines the center of rotation for the molecule to be the geometric center of the selected molecules.
If no atoms are selected the the center is reset to the center of the bounding box defined by the extreme atom centerpoints in each of the x, y, and z dimensions. This is the default.
If one atom is selected then it becomes the center of rotation.
If two or more atoms are selected then the center becomes the point defined by the mean of the x, y, and z coordinates.
{If you think there is a better definition for this (center of gravity? center of the bounding box?) then let us know and we can either change this or add a new definition.}

section.title: Distance...
section.para: Allows you to choose two atoms and display the distance between them.

section.title: Angle...
section.para: Allows you to choose three atoms and display the angle formed about the center atom.

section.title: Dihedral...
section.para: Allows you to choose four atoms and display the Dihedral/Torsion angle between the two planes defined by atoms 1,2,3 and atoms 2,3,4.

section.title: Delete Distance/Angle/Dihedral
section.para: Allows you to delete one or more distance/angle/dihedral measurements.

section.title: Clear all Distances/Angles/Dihedrals
section.para: Self explanatory.

section.title: Clear all Measurements...
section.para: Self explanatory.

section.title: View Measurement List...
section.para: Displays a hierarchical list of all defined measurements.

section.title: Animate...
section.para: Some file formats support multiple frames. A file containing more than one frame is considered an animation. This menu item brings up the animation dialog box which allows you to control the animation playback.

section.title: Vibrate...
section.para: If the molecular model contains frequency information, the vibrational modes can be animated and controlled with the vibrate dialog box.
Note that Display->Vectors should be checked in order to render vibrational vectors.
Good examples are samples/phenylnitrene.g92.out and samples/ammonia.adf.out

section.title: Graph...
section.para: This opens a window in which a energy versus frames plot is viewed. This option currently only works when reading a CML animation with energies given for each frame.
An example file is supplied: conformeren.cml.

section.title: Crystal Properties...
section.para: Opens the crystal properties dialog box.

section.title: About Jmol
section.para: Popups a window with copyright notice for this software.

section.title: User Guide
section.para: Shows this documentation.

section.title: What's New
section.para: Shows the changes from version to version.

section.title: Jmol Console
section.para: Shows the output to the System.out and System.err output streams.

chapter.title: Rasmol Scripts
chapter.para: The scripting language within Jmol is inherited from another 3D viewer, Rasmol. Note that it this time, only a limited amount of commands can be used. All commands mentioned in this chapter do.

section.title: load
section.para: Currently accepted formats are PDB, CML and XYZ.

section.title: script
section.para: Loads and execute a script file from disk.

section.title: exit
section.para: If given from script window, closes this window.

section.title: colour or color
section.para: Gives selected objects a colour as specified by the colour value. Note that color is synonymous with colour.
Currently accepted colour values: black, red, grey, blue, green, cyan, magenta, orange, white and pink.

section.title: echo
section.para: Prints a text to the output.

section.title: refresh
section.para: Redraws the structure.

section.title: set shadows
section.para: Turns on shading when rendering.

section.title: shadows
section.para: Turns on shading when rendering.

section.title: autorefresh
section.para: Does a scripted refresh after every command. Slows down the process a bit, but can be handy when entering commands manually.
